sage.app

Class FixedFrameRateGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • sage.app.AbstractGame
      • sage.app.FixedFrameRateGame

  • public abstract class FixedFrameRateGame
extends AbstractGame
    An abstract class which provides an implementation of a fixed-frame-rate game loop. This class is intended to be extended by clients which provide implementations of AbstractGame.initSystem(), AbstractGame.initGame(), and AbstractGame.shutdown(). The default frame rate for the main loop provided by this class is 60 FPS; client code can set any desired upper bound on the frame rate by calling setMaxFrameRate(int). Clients can query the current frame rate using getInstantaneousFPS(). Clients should call setGameOver(boolean) to indicate the game is over and the main loop should terminate.
    Author:
    John Clevenger

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public final void start()
        Description copied from class: AbstractGame
        start() is the entry point for every game; it should be invoked from main() to begin the game. Every implementation of start() should invoke AbstractGame.initSystem(), AbstractGame.initGame(), and then AbstractGame.mainLoop(), followed by invoking AbstractGame.shutdown() and AbstractGame.exit() after AbstractGame.mainLoop() returns.
        Specified by:
        start in class AbstractGame

      • mainLoop

        protected final void mainLoop()
        Description copied from class: AbstractGame
        mainLoop() executes the "main loop" of a game, by repeatedly invoking AbstractGame.handleInput(float), AbstractGame.update(float), and AbstractGame.render() until AbstractGame.isGameOver() returns true.
        Specified by:
        mainLoop in class AbstractGame

      • setGameOver

        public final void setGameOver(boolean isOver)
        Sets the game over flag to the value of parameter. The game over flag is used to determine whether the fixed-frame-rate game main loop should continue running.
        Specified by:
        setGameOver in class AbstractGame
        Parameters:
        isOver - True if the game is over
        See Also:
        AbstractGame.mainLoop()

      • isGameOver

        public final boolean isGameOver()
        Returns the value of the game over flag
        Specified by:
        isGameOver in class AbstractGame
        Returns:
        - the current game-over flag state

      • setMaxFrameRate

        public final void setMaxFrameRate(int rate)
        Sets the desired frame rate to the specified value, and resets the "startTime" (the time from which frame rate calculations begin) and the "sleepcount". The default maximum frame rate value (that is, the value if this method is never invoked) is 60 FPS.
        Parameters:
        rate - The desired (upper limit) frame rate
        See Also:
        getSleepCount()

      • getInstantaneousFPS

        public final float getInstantaneousFPS()
        Returns the instantaneous frame rate -- that is, the frames per second rate based on the most recently rendered frame (only).

      • getAverageFPS

        public final float getAverageFPS()
        Returns the overall average frame rate -- that is, the total elapsed time divided by the total number of frames rendered.
        Returns:
        the current overall average frames-per-second rate

      • getWeightedAverageFPS

        public final float getWeightedAverageFPS()
        Returns the average frame rate (Frames Per Second) as determined by a moving average calculated over the last 100 frames.
        Returns:
        the average frame rate over the last 100 frames

      • getSleepCount

        public final int getSleepCount()
        Returns the value of the internal sleepCount variable. The main loop implemented by this class attempts to maintain the frame rate at precisely the desired frame rate (which defaults to 60 FPS and can be set by calling setMaxFrameRate(int). In the event the main loop is proceeding too fast (that is, the frame rate is too high), the main loop method automatically inserts Thread.sleep(long) calls to add additional delays; the value returned by this method indicates how many times additional sleep calls have been added since the start of the loop (or, if the frame rate has been changed, since the last call to setMaxFrameRate(int).
        Returns:
        The number of sleep calls which have occurred in the main loop since the loop began (or since the frame rate was set to a new value)

      • exit

        protected void exit()
        Shuts down the Java Virtual Machine (exits the program). This method is called following any call to AbstractGame.shutdown(), which occurs whenever the mainLoop() exits due to the game over flag being set.
        Specified by:
        exit in class AbstractGame
        See Also:
        setGameOver(boolean)
